issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Discovered when implementing the image launch permissions update feature on the user console, when the call "ModifyImageAttribute" is made to alter the image's group permission, thus allowing it to be either public or private, the call ends up deleting the image description, making it empty.

On Eucalyptus, the python lines below would set the image permission to be "public" and deletes the image description:

p_params = { 'ImageId': self.image.id, 'LaunchPermission.Add.1.Group': 'all' }
self.conn.get_status('ModifyImageAttribute', lp_params, verb='POST')

Such behavior was not detected when tried the same call on AWS.
fields.summary: When 'ModifyImageAttribute' API is made to alter the launch permissions, the call deletes image description.

comments.body:
I was not able to reproduce this issue with euca2ools:

Hmm, does euca2ools use boto to modify the image attributes?

I have learned that boto's modify-image-attribute function hasn't been updated to support the image description update, which was why it was needed to use the API directly using "ModifyImageAttribute", as shown below

self.conn.get_status('ModifyImageAttribute', lp_params, verb='POST')

Would this be the issue?
Euca2ools does not use boto, but the parameters are the same as in your example. If you can log or capture the request it would be useful.

I see. I will checkout euca2ools on how it's making the call. 

by the way, how do we I capture the request log from Eucalyptus? Is there a specific flag I can set from the config file?
The request log (cloud-requests.log) should capture some info without any configuration changes, but may not record the full request.
Also confirmed that this issue is no longer reproducible. It must have been an intermittent issue during the development of the feature on the GUI side. Sorry about the mistake. Closing the ticket.
